definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: Use tags to group articles on similar topics into categories.
sentences.chinese: 用標籤將相似的文章分門別類。

sentences.english: Every week, I sort them into this sorter.
sentences.chinese: 每週，我把它們分門別類整理到這個分類盒子裏。

sentences.english: The procedure of exporting germplasm should, therefore, be specific to the species.
sentences.chinese: 出口種質的程序因此也應當詳細精確地分門別類。
我們很難把乳酪分門別類。

sentences.english: It will make you the breakdown-cool cool.
sentences.chinese: 它將令您的各種資料分門別類，清清爽爽。

sentences.english: but there is more to education than the segmental equipping of the mind.
sentences.chinese: 但是教育的責任不僅在於把頭腦分門別類武裝起來。

definition: disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
to receive/to accept/to take in/to hold
lit. looking for a fine horse using only a picture (idiom)/fig. to do things along rigid, conventional lines/to try and find sth with the help of a clue
to distribute/distribution/to assign (sb) to a job
